data.text:
@TechNizzleX It wad kind of an explanation to why my colds took so long to ho away,  and why I got strep and ear infections so much.

It honestly might even explain why my body didn't properly fight the giardia I had too.

@TechNizzleX I was in my mid twenties.

It was the second time I tested positive for pertussis in a 2 year period that they started to suspect it because not only did I have a recent vaccination,  but because I had pertussis like 14 months prior I should have still had a natural resistance to

@LilliranaG I googled it and It's a hunerd percent a PIDD. That's straight wild. How long did it take for them to properly diagnose it?

Apparently "There are more than 200 different forms of primary immune deficiency diseases (PIDDs)." >< holy wow!

@TechNizzleX I have something called a selective antibody deficiency,  which might be what you're talking about.

I've had the pertussis vaccine half a dozen times

I've also had pertussis half a dozen times because my body literally cannot manufacture antibodies for it.

Our bodies are weird

@LilliranaG I recently learned that are primary immunodeficiency diseases that mean the affected person can't gain protective immunities from vaccines ever, and alot of affected people can carry on getting them (or not) without ever knowing!
@LilliranaG People like to prop themselves up on a moral highground on anything they can. It's quite pathetic ngl.
